meanings.definition: To act in an exaggerated or excessive manner.
meanings.sent1: She was overacting in the school play by making big gestures.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overact in his movie roles, which can be distracting.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was overacting on purpose to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were overacting like a storm in a teacup.
meanings.sent5: The child's overacting made the scene unforgettable.

meanings.definition: The action of performing in an exaggerated or excessive manner.
meanings.sent1: His overacting in the play was criticized by the director.
meanings.sent2: The actor's overacting overshadowed the rest of the cast.
meanings.sent3: The overacting in the comedy show had everyone in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech was full of overacting and false promises.
meanings.sent5: The overacting in the horror movie made it more funny than scary.
